The Producer Price Index (PPI) excludes import prices & hence does not directly reflect the impact of tariffs.
PPI measures domestic producer prices only per the Bureau of Labor Statistics.

2022 was the year when risk-off Treasuries failed to counter risk-on stocks as a hedge against volatility.

2025 could be the flight-to-safety trade back into Treasuries finally returns.

If I‚Äôm right, the ATAC Credit Rotation ETF $JOJO can potentially benefit.

Learn more about $JOJO at atacfunds.com/jojo/

Lead-Lag Publishing, LLC is not an affiliate of Tidal/Toroso or ACA/Foreside.

One final note.

I plan on doing more threads to address $ATACX, and $RORO in the weeks ahead.
Each Fund has different signals to rotate risk-on, or risk-off.

But they all rely on Treasuries as the risk-off trade.
This is not about signals.

This is about cycles.
(10/10)

Now there is yield for bond funds, like $JOJO.
Now there are tactical opportunities for bond funds, like $JOJO.

Keep an open mind.

One year does not invalidate decades of research.

Consider $JOJO as part of your bond allocation. (9/10)

$JOJO may be able to take advantage of the high yields and return potential of junk bonds when skies are clear, but quickly pivot to the ‚Äúflight to safety trade‚Äù of Treasuries.

That flight to safety trade failed in 2022, hurting all ATAC Funds.

I believe it comes back now. (8/10)

At some point if Japan sparks a global credit event, credit spreads likely blow out and junk debt becomes painful.

That is what $JOJO is built for ‚Äì to tactically avoid those credit events, and hide in long duration Treasuries as those events are occurring. (7/10)

I launched $JOJO arguably at the exact wrong time, as Treasuries for the first time in history suffered a drawdown larger than the stock market in 2022.

Had I known this was coming in this EXACT way, I wouldn't have launched in July of 2021.

I would launch $JOJO now. (6/10)

Since the 1920s, the 10-year Treasury bond has declined by more than 10% once - an 11% loss in 2009 during the financial crisis.

In 2022 it lost 18% making it only the 2nd time this ever happened.

We believe there is now an opportunity in Treasuries, in risk-off. (5/10)

In periods of heightened volatility for the stock market, two things typically happen on average.

1) Credit spreads widen as bond investors perceive volatility in stocks as increasing default risk.

2) Treasuries become the "flight-to-safety" trade during stress.

(4/10)

$JOJO uses the relative performance of Utilities against US Large-Cap Stocks to determine when to be junk-on in high yield bond ETFs, or junk-off in long-duration Treasuries.

Why?

As shown in the 2014 Dow Award paper, Utilities historically signal higher volatility. (4/10)

I have seen some argue that I am ducking criticisms around my Funds.

These comments do not understand how my industry works.

This thread is meant to set the record straight on the conditions $JOJO is designed for. (3/10)

First, allow me to clarify that all of my rules-based Funds are separate from my research (The Lead-Lag Report).

Rules-based means the Funds are not based on my discretionary thinking.
